DOC.HEAD: Eds: SUBS 2nd item to CORRECT spelling of Johnny in 1st graf
DOC.TEXT: Johnny Board, a jazz tenor saxophonist who was once a sideman with Count Basie and Coleman Hawkins, died Friday at age 70 after a long illness. A South Side resident, Board graduated from DuSable High School, where he studied under bandmaster Walter Dyett. Board toured the country with several name bands in the 1960s, and was featured at a number of Chicago venues, including the old Gaslight Club.
